Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Very good photo quality; Monster 24X, 25 - 600 mm Leica lens; Power OIS image stabilization, with "active" mode for movies; 3-inch LCD with 460,000 pixels, good outdoor visibility; Full manual controls, with numerous ways to adjust white balance, plus a customizable button and spot on the mode dial; Intelligent Auto mode does it all for you, including scene selection, face detection, blur reduction, shadow brightening, and smart sharpening; Robust performance, especially focusing and shot-to-shot speeds; Lots of scene modes and special effects; Intelligent Resolution sharpens photos,and gives you a 1.3x boost in zoom power with a minimal drop in image quality; Intelligent Dynamic brightens shadows (though not in all situations); Fast burst mode, though buffer fills quickly; 3D still ... capability; Redeye not an issue; Records movies at 1080/60i (30p sensor output) with stereo sound and continuous autofocus using AVCHD or MPEG-4 codecs -- manual controls available -- optical zoom and image stabilizer can be used while recording; Support for wide-angle and close-up conversion lenses and filters; HDMI output
Cons: Photos on the noisy side -- highest sensitivities should be avoided; Images have yellow/brownish cast in artificial light -- still no fluorescent white balance option; No RAW support; Buffer fills after just seven shots in burst mode; No redeye removal tool in playback mode (though you may not need it); Can't access memory card while camera is on a tripod; Full manual on CD-ROM; No composite A/V cable or Mac software included
The Lumix DMC-FZ47 offers a lot of camera for under $400. Some of the "big" features include a "giant" 24X, 25 - 600 mm lens, optical image stabilization, manual and automatic controls, robust performance, and a Full HD movie mode. Photo quality is good by compact camera standards, though images are on the noisy side (though details remain intact until higher sensitivities). The only other real downsides are yellow or brownish color casts in artificial light (common to Panasonic cameras, unfortunately), a lack of RAW support, and a few bundle annoyances. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
The Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ47 looks very similar to the more expensive LUMIX FZ150, albeit missing its flash hot-shoe and with a slightly squarer body. It’s £142 less expensive, too, but still has a reasonably high retail price of £247. If you need a camera with an extreme zoom range, the LUMIX DMC-FZ47 is a good choice: its 24x lens is sharp enough throughout the range to create clear pictures, with only a little resolution lost at maximum zoom. Its ‘bridge’ design also makes it easy to hold comfortably. Design and features The Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ47 is based on the tried-and-tested layout of larger digital SLR cameras like the Canon EOS 600D, Olympus E-5 and Nikon D7000, with a large handgrip, top-mounted viewfinder and large lens barrel. ‘Bridge’ cameras like these are usually go ... od all-in-one models with versatile performances: their comparatively large size (for a compact digital camera, which houses a smaller imaging sensor than a digital SLR) means a large zoom lens can be built in, and controls can be generously laid out and labelled.We think the shape of the LUMIX FZ47 is near-ideal, with the user’s hands able to rest comfortably around the grip and lens barrel. Controls are also easy to manipulate with thumb and forefinger, and all fall easily to hand without any stretching required. Less impressive is the camera’s LCD viewfinder and rear screen. Neither are bad, but you can find superior options available when stepping up to price-competitive Micro Four Thirds interchangeable lens cameras like Panasonic’s own LUMIX DMC-G3 and Olympus PEN Lite E-PL3. The electronic viewfinder is very small compared to these competitors, with only a small window that the viewer’s eye must be directly in front of for proper usage. The LCD screen is a good size at 3in, but its resolution is middling at 430K-pixels, with some other brands’ superzooms using 960K-pixel displays. Surprisingly for a high-end compact camera, the Panasonic FZ47 cannot capture images in the RAW file format, which allows for more in-camera editing and processing on PC, as well as higher quality images. Previous FZ models had this feature so we’re assuming its removal serves to delineate between basic consumer compacts and the more enthusiast-targeted Micro Four Thirds line in Panasonic’s camera range. Given the camera’s high price we were expecting it to be included. Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ47: Image and video quality and performance The 12.1-megapixel CCD sensor inside the Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ47 is of reasonably good quality, giving good results in good lighting. The lens is similarly high quality and the combination means the FZ47 is a versatile camera in daylight or well-lit conditions. It struggles in darker conditions, though, and at these times is best used at minimum zoom levels for the clearest possible images; otherwise the combination of poor high ISO performance, a long focal length and slow lens aperture means blur and image noise is inevitable.
This image shows the good detail levels possible with the FZ47 in good light. This shot was taken at the minimum zoom level at ISO 100. The lens of the FZ47 reaches from 25mm-600mm (in 35mm film or ‘full frame’ digital SLR equivalent terms); that is, it can capture anything from a reasonably wide scene to an extremely tight zoomed-in one. You won’t find a lens this versatile on any digital SLR or interchangeable lens camera, so if your requirements are this specific you’ll need to consider the FZ47 amongst a very select range of competitors: Canon’s PowerShot SX40 HS, the Nikon Coolpix P500, and the Olympus SP-810UZ.
This image was taken handheld at full zoom. If you compare it to the previous photo you’ll see the huge difference in the widest and most telephoto zoom angles of the FZ47. Detail levels are OK but not great at full zoom. The lens can focus very close, but only at its minimum zoom level of 25mm. The end result means that you’ll have the FZ47 literally pressed up against the subject. Panasonic includes a petal-shape lens hood that shields... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Smooth HD video, excellent color, good handling, numerous shooting modes
Cons: No RAW support, noisy at all ISO levels
Reviewers say the 12.1-megapixel Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 is worth a look since it offers a lot of features for the price. It has a 24x zoom lens and full HD (1080p) video recording, along with an Intelligent Auto mode that experts say does an excellent job of adapting to various lighting conditions. ...

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Camera for $ Can't be beat...
Item.Review:
Pros: Huge 24x optical zoom and Sharp lens quality. Great program controls plus color accuracy with processor. High MPixels. Manual and artistic effects controls. HD video and Stereo sound. Has recessed threads on lens permitting filter use. Batterypack holds charge very well. Image.Stabilized works quite well.
Cons: Sound recording could be better. An included micro HDMI cable would have been nice. The "free" case was half the size needed for the camera, LOL.
Replaced my Cxxxn S1 that died. This Camera is better and cost half as much than the Cxxxn I bought 4+ years ago.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have had four or five FZ models over the years and the Lumix fZ47 is by far the most interesting model yet. After shooting a few hundred images, I think I have begun to understand this camera. First of all, it is by far the most color accurate FZ camera I've ever owned, better than many entry level DLSRs and a few pro DSLR. It produces some of the most gorgeous skin tones I have ever seen in digital imagery. The FZ47 does appear to blow out highlights in contrasty daylight scenes. However this is mostly resolved by setting the Exposure Compensation control--the (+/-) button on the camera back-- to -2/3 stop. This improves highlights, overall contrast and all without the image going too dark. The FZ's ISO range of 100-1600 is very conservative. At ISO 100 and 200 images are very sharp ... and produce great 8x10 or 11x14 inch prints. At ISO 400 through 1600, there are noise issues and images are somewhat soft yet they still produce reasonably clear and sharp 8x10s. The Leica Vario-Elmarit lens is simply astonishing throughout its range and at full 600mm extension produces tack sharp images. I'd suggest I'd the FZ47 as an alternative to a 600mm for someone who shoots a DSLR. At a fraction of the price of most 600mm interchangeable mount lenses, you get a fast F5.2 lens that with the camera's Image Stabilizer system, lets you take sharp photos hand held. Videos are in Panasonic's AVCHD format or standard MP4s. They are very good but this is not quite full HDTV. That shortcoming is made up for by the ability to silently zoom the lens while taking videos. If you are shooting videos for sharing, this camera will do the job. The fZ47 is the kind of general purpose camera that excels at what it does within its limitations. I would recommend this camera, especially to anyone looking at an entry level DLSR but who has no desire to later buy lots of lenses. This is camera for the photo enthusiast who just wants lovely pictures and doesn't need the weight and the status of owning a DSLR. Oddly like many other reviewers I bought this camera for my daughter (is this a trend??) but then I also bought one for myself. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera because I didn't want to waste money on a dslr as a casual photographer, but it turned out to be a near perfect choice. The build quality, screen, wonderful creative control mode effects are great. The only cons would be the focus button, instead of a real manual option, but this doesn't make macro shots much more difficult. This camera's motion picture mode is perfect for anyone that wants to make a stop motion video without compromising on quality. The only other downfall would be the grainy pictures and video in low-light, otherwise a great choice.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: 1. Camera has a full manual mode and it's intuitive; if you already know how to use a manual camera you'll be up and running in minutes.
2. Has a manual focus mode, although it takes some getting used to, this is a big plus for me and I miss it on cameras that don't have it.
3. Very nice lens! The zoom will reach on out there with a minimum of distortion.
4. Camera is one of the fastest I've seen to power up and to take the shot. This camera's speed is DSLR-comparable.
5. Photo quality is very good, although you still get some noise at high ISO, it's minimal compared to other cameras I've owned such as Canon and Fuji.
6. Comes with a lens hood for sunlight or bright light conditions.
7. Fast battery charge, approx. 150 minutes deplet ... ed-to-full.
8. Takes full HD video.
Cons: 1. Location of controls is different from most other cameras and takes a bit to get used to.
2. Full manual available only on CD; the printed "basic" manual's print is very small and doesn't include camera first-time set-up instructions which are only available in the full manual.
3. Uses a battery-pack rather than standard batteries. Not a big deal, but I prefer rechargeable AA's.
4. Camera is as large as a DSLR; this isn't a pocket camera by any means. You'll need a carrying case.
5. If you are a professional photographer, you will need to buy a second battery.
6. No hot shoe (although the built-in flash works well).
This is an extremely powerful camera and takes good quality photos. I certainly think it would be a great "second" or take-along camera for a photographer.
If you are new to advanced cameras, expect some learning curve. The good news there is that the camera has a "full auto" mode which is just point-and-shoot, as well as special-scene modes. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Japanese made Bridge Camera with a stellar 24x Leica lens, excellent JPEG conversion, and full HD Video, however there is no RAW output
Item.Review:
Pros: The FZ47 is a great long zoom lens bridge camera; the best presently on the market IMHO considering the price. (Lacks RAW-see Cons). Build quality is great as the FZ47 is made of a good amount of stainless steel & aluminum, not just cheap plastic. Image quality is excellent up until ISO 400 & the HD video works well. The lens is very sharp particularly considering the focal length. I purchased an FZ40 last year from Newegg & thought is was very good. It extended the focal length of the FZ35, but was noisier above ISO 100 & slower. I recently gave the FZ40 to a relative & just purchased the FZ47. I couldn't be more pleased. Lowering the resolution to 12MP on this small sensor camera means the FZ47 is much more responsive than the FZ40 with much less noise below ISO ... 800. Video is superior as well - full 1080 HD in AVCHD with MP4 too. The 460K LCD is beautiful and much improved over the FZ40 LCD. It makes composing images a breeze. The EVF, while not rivaling the LCD, is still quite good.
Cons: The only drawback I can see is a lack of RAW output. For some this will be a problem, for others a deal-breaker, but it's not an issue for me. Some will be upset as previous offerings in the same line (FZ40) retained RAW. Lumix models split with the pricey FZ100 & affordable FZ40. Panasonic has now decided to leave RAW only in the FZ150. I have only shot RAW on a handful of occasions with bridge cameras. It makes no sense from my perspective where JPEG conversion is good, as with the FZ47. For me a great bridge camera like the FZ47 gives you a great long zoom, is fast to use, has very good image quality, good video, & is a small camera that is easy to carry around. RAW is usually slow on bridge cameras, & if you need RAW quality & know how to process it you should probably consider a DSLR. I have a Nikon D7000 with dual card slots; I set one card to JPEG the other to RAW, however I'd need to carry 1/2 dozen very heavy lenses to come close to the one small fixed zoom lens on the FZ47.
I've owned FZ models since the FZ35. I foolishly sold my FZ35 years back, & it was too crazy expensive to buy one used when I realized my mistake. The FZ47 is the true successor to the FZ35. In lowering the CCD sensor to 12MP from the FZ40's 14MP, the FZ47 has image quality comparable to the FZ35 with a much longer zoom. The FZ35 is a bit faster, but the difference is negligible, & the FZ47 has much better video than either the FZ35 or FZ40. I have not used the CMOS based FZ150, but I can't justify spending a fortune for a bridge camera. I used an FZ100, & like most people, was shocked at the poor performance. Almost everyone agrees that the FZ40 was superior to the FZ100 in image quality, and the FZ47 is better than the FZ40. The FZ100 had fast burst mode and an articulated LCD but the poorest image quality of any FZ I've used. Perhaps the 12MP CMOS FZ150 is better, but it is still too expensive. Again, you do lose RAW output with an FZ47, so if you need it you should look elsewhere. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Used this camera to take pictures on my trip to Europe. I wanted the same or better quality of digital photos like my Canon Eos with my two great but heavy wide angle and telephoto SLR lenses. Since I was going to be walking/moving from one location to the next, I needed something light weight but sophisticated. This Panasonic camera does that and more- the video option is a wonderful feature as well as the super zoom capability! Thus, this camera is versatile, takes crisp photos, and lightweight. I enjoyed the fact that I didn't have to bring my large case and switch lenses thereby enjoying more of what was there to experience. I did not like the omission of some type of soft case nor the clumsy way the lens hood attached when in the stored (backward) position. Certainly for the p ... rice, a complimentary 2 GB smart card would have been a nice touch. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is the latest in a line of Panasonic Lumix cameras I have used for general outdoor photography and birding (FZ7, FZ18, FZ35). This camera works and feels very similar to the previous versions, with excellent overall functionality and picture quality. However, there are a couple aspects that could be better. When Panasonic upgrades their cameras, they usually change battery models as well, so that when I get a new camera after wearing out the old one (9-13K photos), I have these fairly expensive batteries sitting around that no longer fit anything. Since I tend to purchase a couple extras, this adds up after a few model changes. The cables to connect this to your computer also change between models, so I end up with these extra USB cables that no longer mean anything. Is there so ... me reason they can't just stick with a battery and connector and run with it? Second, the spot focus mode does not allow you to lock in a small spot in the center for focus as a fixed setting like the previous models. It will default to a medium sized spot, but if you want to change to the small spot, you have to scroll through the menu (about 6 clicks down and three right, then a center or wheel click) to get to the small spot setting, which will remain only as long as the camera is on. Once you turn off the camera, it resets to the medium spot and you have to do it all over again the next time the camera turns on. This is really annoying when I am birding, since I tend to need to focus on a small point in the field of view (such as an eye) to get the autofocus at the right spot. I can live without the little scroll wheel on the back, too. Too easy to accidentally roll it and change a setting when you do not want to, as it is right under my right thumb most of the time. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: As a non-professional bird photographer I have used the Panasonic FZ super zoom series for over 10 years, and have be completely satisfied. I need a rugged camera that is light weight, quick and easy to use. The FZ 40 or FZ 47 (very much alike) when coupled with the Panasonic 1.5 Multiplier make a great combination for bird photography. The 47 provides full sized HD video with deblur on moving subjects ... very impressive. If you want to do lots of video then get the FZ 47. If HD video is not important then the FZ 40 is very similar and provide the ability to store RAW files. For some reason the FZ 47 dropped this storage mode. Now some downsides ... No flash hot shoe for external flash. No remote shutter release provisions. Must remove tripod mounting plate to replace batteries/sd card ... . expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great specs, video, zoom, lens,speed, auto mode.
Got it for 189.99 during thanksgiving weekend , I feel I won a lottery at that price point !!
Cons: None about the camera.
The freebee Dolicia bag was way to small for this Camera !!

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Does almost everything I want (and some
Item.Review: Point and shoot cameras seem to be getting very versatile, but they are also getting too complex. I got this camera to taking on a birding trip because it had a great range (optical 24X zoom) and a viewfinder. I really dislike using a screen to compose a picture, particularly in the bright sun. I wanted a point and shoot because they are compact for the zoom range (and much less costly than a DSLR). This camera worked very well and took great pictures which zoom in with high resolution.But there are just too many different custom settings, some of which appeared when I inadvertently pressed a button and I had no idea how to undo it. While normally convenient and comfortable to hold, it proved awkward when the sunshade was on in reverse (storage) mode. Some dials were very small and ha ... rd to operate, such as the viewfinder diopter adjustment and the (critical) rear dial. The latter dial made manual focusing very difficult. When the subject, such as a bird, was too small to fill the focus area, manual focusing was the only way to go. But I never got the hang of it and missed a number of shots.So yes get this camera, but expect a long learning curve. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality, speed, options, zoom...almost everything about the camera. And Newegg itself, which is always great.
Cons: Only JPG output, auto settings in low light*, came with a weird bundle that included a case that wasn't even close to being big enough.
*The intelligent auto settings it chooses for low light situations usually produce grainy pictures, but you can set it to program mode to always select ISO 100, and the shutter speed is usually still fast enough to avoid blurring.
Got this before Xmas under two hundred dollars, and my wife absolutely loves it because it's a huge improvement over our point-and-shoot. I was mainly considering DSLRs, but after some extensive research I went ahead with this one. The tradeoffs (much lower price vs the main cons ... ) are well-worth it for someone like my wife who doesn't want to worry about lenses.
My wife has been singing the praises for her new camera, and I'll certainly look to these Panasonic superzooms for recommendations and gifts in the future. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: My daughter wanted to make a jump from a point and shoot to a more advanced camera. This has been a good choice as it has automatic as well as full manual mode. Great color accuarcy. Wish pictures could be viewed without activating lense.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Review of Lumix DMC-Fz47 for macro shots
Item.Review: I bought a DMC FZ47 after trying one out in a camera shop in San Francisco. My main application is needing an affordable camera for macro photography. Specifically, I shoot macro shots of small living moths. The model I bought from BH is actually better than the one I tried in CA. For one, it has a rechargable battery, which is handy. The view find is sufficiently large that it is easy to see the object (moth). The response time on the shutter is also sufficiently fast (I have a limited amount of time to get the shot). The resolution is pretty good. I find that the camera will auto focus in macro mode at < 1 cm distances, but a lensing effect is visible at the margins of the shots. The pixel resolution of the camer is sufficient enough, that what I typically do is to back off to 2 ... -3 cm (it seems too far away to be useful), and the image comes out fine, with sufficient resolution of fine features (scales, etc.). Thus far I haven't found any major negative aspects of the camera. I have only used it in macro mode thus far. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: First of all, I am not a professional photographer. I am a photo hobbyist. Second, I am not rich to buy the newest high technologic cameras. Therefore, I can not compare it with EOS or DSLR. And, I only had this camera for 8 days since 12/5/11. My feeling for this camera is So Far So Good. I like this camera for the following reasons: * It is easy to use. * It shoots clear colorful pictures. * Zooming is powerful. I could zoom when I was video recording. * Each function really does what it supposes to do. Well, there are some CONS. * Lag is slow. It takes time for camera to get ready to shoot pictures from one function to another. For instance, when I changed from Intelligent Auto to Night Portrait, it usually take about 2-3 seconds to get ready to shoot. If I clicked immediately, the pi ... cture was not clear. * Night Portrait and Sports pictures have blurs. For sports, the moving is faster, the picture has more blurs. * If the optical zoom is over 24x, the picture is getting blurs. Overall, this is the best camera I ever had in my life. I play with it everyday. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: FZ 47 is much more than a Super Zoom
Item.Review: The amazing fact of this camera is that you have all manual controls, like apperture priority, shutter speed priority and Manual Exposition, then you have control of everything inthis camera. The zoom is perfect, 24x. It's so powerful that you don't need to use the inteligent digital zoom. Do I need to say something about the lens? Ok, I'll say: LEICA. Amazing camera, impossible to regret, and if you compare the price of this camera with others you will just could find point and shoot cameras. The best relation price-benefits in the world. The camera has also a lot of automatic function that can make an experient photographer like me impressed, like the Pin Hole, Expressive, Film Grain and others. To finish with perfection, it can make movies in HD. I don't need anything else. Completely ... satisfied with this... and I have also a DSLR that I can't see where is the expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am just a casual photographer, not an expert by any means, and wanted a camera that I could use for family photos and sometimes outdoors/wildlife photos. I also wanted a camera that had a viewfinder as well as the LCD display. So far the FZ47 fits the bill. I would not compare it to a DSLR, but the pictures are very good. As a test I took the camera to a local pond with alot of ducks. It was late afternoon and overcast, getting dark, and my hands were freezing, so I just took really quick pics on the auto setting. I took some pictures of some wood ducks at max zoom (24x) and I was expecting them to come out somewhat fuzzy when I loaded on my computer. Not so! They were quite clear! I still have alot to learn about the FZ47, but so far I'm pretty impressed!

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great camera - lightweight, good performance, good feature set. Low light shots are so-so. Pretty good video capture. Great quality. Great for an occasional camera - much lighter and more practical than a dSLR and better than a regular point and shoot. Great for family events, on vacation, etc.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: for the price $190 you cannot beat the deal. Long zoom, compact for bridge camera, fast boot, fast focus, manual settings and manual focus, which I found difficult to use but it is there is you need it. auto bracketing +/- 3.
Cons: the panorama mode is much less useful than the one on Fuji S4000. Burst speed is slow and limited to 7 shots. Cannot pause while taking video. EVF image is distorted around the corner.
i had a Fuji S4000 for a while, which in my opinion is comparable or better than FZ47 except for slower focusing and nosier video. anyone considering FZ47 should also take a look of S4000 which is $60 less and takes 4 AA.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: I took Bridge Bob's review, as well as those on other sites. I got the camera last night and played around with it from my chair. Across the living room, into the den, one picture I shot some printed material in a dark spot (about 15 feet away). The picture was unbelievable, I could read the fine print that my son could barely read holding it in his hands. I have had 3 Fuji, 2 Nikon, 1 Casio, 1 GE, and at least 3 others since digital point and shoots have come out to the masses. The only one that was less expensive was the GE and it eats batteries like crazy, and the pictures are no very good. Expense not being the only consideration, but a big one after trying so many cameras, this is perfect for my use. We usually use around the house, yard for family pictures. No camera I ... have has ever been able to produce a quality picture, with a flash any any meaningful distance with the quality of this camera.
Cons: Wish I didn't have so many lackluster cameras. Okay for the kids to tear up I guess.
I was lucky and got it on sale last week for considerably less money. Even at its full price, a reasonable person would be thrilled with the pictures this camera takes. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this to replace a regular point and shoot (Sony Cybershot) and I could not be more pleased to do it! The Lumix has comprehensive resources to one that love play with shutter speed, aperture, ISO, etc. but do not want to replace lens or carry on a 10 pound back pack with camera and accessories. The FZ47 is very fast on zooming, focusing and taking burst shots. Pictures has great colors and a nice contrast. The 24x zoom is awesome! You should expect some grain on low illuminated scenario, but nothing that will let you down.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Best Point and Shoot without a doubt
Item.Review: Bought this camera to replace my aging Olympus high end point and shoot model C-5050. The C-5050 was a great camera and I was hesitant to leave the Olympus brand but after a friend gave the Panasonic the thumbs up and lack of a bad review online I pulled the trigger right before going on my honeymoon...and what a good decision this was!! I will be purchasing a DSLR for higher end pictures but this camera will fit the bill till then and my wife loves using this for herself. BUY THIS CAMERA, AND B&H'S PRICE AND SHIPPING CANNOT BE BEAT.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm just a beginning photographer going on my first cruise. Bought the camera early so I could learn to use it BEFORE I embark on this trip. Have had no problems with the basic functions of point and shoot. Haven't tried any of the advanced features YET! Love that it still has a view finder which many cameras don't have. It's light which I like because it's always hanging around my neck. Only thing I wasn't happy with is that it doesn't come with a very good small manual. I'm not going to print and carry around a 188 page binder!!! This means I have to comfortably know how to use the camera before the trip and pray there's no problems. All checked off items listed above are based on limited use and beginners knowledge.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I've only had this camera for about two weeks, but I've been testing it outdoors and indoors and have been pretty disappointed with the image quality. For a 12mpx leica lens, it should be a lot better than my old 5mpx canon point and shoot - but it's not. The images are grainy and the color quality pretty flat. Aside from the nice zoom lens, the extensive manual settings and view finder, for a point and shoot, the image quality is truly lacking- so none of the bells and whistles are meaningful in the end. I'm hoping to exchange it for something else. Maybe it's safer to go back to a Canon or Nikon.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: It is very easy to use, the presets work great the camera sets you up for the best looking pictures. The zoom is great and the image stab. works great to help your pictures stable when shooting. Movie mode is amazing, it looks better than my camcorder and the zoom, autofocus and image stab. all work when recording. The auto focus or AF is very fast and accurate. I find pictures in low light look great 90% of the time but using the flash will take care of the ones that need more light and it works great. B&H was great, I ordered it on one day and got it the next day and that was using the free shipping option, I do live just a state away but all the stuff I have gotten from B&H has come quickly and with no issues.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, LOTS of options, GREAT pictures, ZOOM, and many more.
Cons: Came with a free bag that was too small. Not a big deal, I was planning on getting one anyways.
The wife uses it WAY more than I do and she LOVES it. It is not a DSLR, but it is really, really good still.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am a recreational photographer interested in taking better shots. I did lots of research and in this category, sub-DSLR, it came down to this or the Nikon 500. I opted for this one because of some of the features and from what I read online, a better video experience. We have kids and want to get lots of photos. Our previous digital camera took great shots, but didn't handle close-ups well and the video was primitive at best. This does everything well. Personally I think you're better off getting a nicer digital camera than paying 3 times this amount for a DSLR. I couldn't justify the difference and really feel this is a bargain for the price. I do recommend doing yoour due dilligence so you know you get the model you want and don't end up with buyer's remorse.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is my first DSLR and it has not failed to meet my expectations. I wanted a camera that allowed both a Novice and an Advanced Amature to enjoy using this camera. This camera met both needs. The automatic function works wonderfully well. Focusing was fast and easy. The Ai setting provided an idiot proof way to take great shots. The rest of the programs and the location of the function buttons made it easy for those with more skills to optimise on its capability. The 24x zoom and the wide lens range (from Leica) makes this a one stop camera for those with creative needs but dont want to spend tons of $$ on expensive camera bodies and lens.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Okay, for the price I paid (on sale), it's a decent camera. But it doesn't even come close to matching the video quality of the Panasonic GH2 it was intended to be a B-cam for... colors are faded, noise is high, and stills look like a point-n-shoot. If you are looking for a good family camera it'll do the job, but if you need a B-cam for pro shoots look elsewhere.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Panasonic's image quality in this line has always been excellent. The FZ47 continues that but they have made the camera easier to operate (change settings). Wish it had an articulating screen & a hot shoe (=FZ150, but out of my budget). It's a great, versatile & lightweight camera. I recommend getting an extra battery.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: intuitive ui and easy to learn to use, and take pictures. in addition to having manual controls to your liking. picture quality is great, and for the price a steal.
Cons: wish the shutter speed was faster for taking action shots in fps. the fz150 version is faster but the 47 is still more than sufficient. guess shldve got the higher end version. but im more than satisfied

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted a good point and shoot camera that has a great optical zoom plus is good for closeups. This camera has it. I'm able to get some great shots that weren't possible before with what I was using. The camera is not too heavy or bulky. I look forward to playing with it more as I haven't come close to using all the features it offers.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought it with an SDXC 95Mb/s transfer rate, and it is fast, w/ excellent photo quality, and the best video rec (HD 1080p stereo). Up to now I feel happy about my purchase.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Everyone is jelous when they see it!
Item.Review: Haven't had time to use it alot but I'm very impressred with the flower pic I've taken and the macro lens is great. Look forward to using it on trips in the future.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Purchased this camera for my daughter and it works great. I was most impressed with how easy and intuitive the menu system is compared to my Sony Cybershot DSC-HX7V. The self-timer functionality is quick to get to and has a multi-shot mode that she really likes. Turning on and off the date/time stamp is quick too. Also, my Cybershot takes forever to turn on and it takes nearly 10 seconds to actually start recoding a video when moving from photo to video. The DMC-FZ47 starts up very fast and starting to record a video is more like 2-3 seconds. This can be crucial for capturing the moment. Finally someone put some thought into ease of use instead of the normal labyrinth of menus that just become frustrating.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am just learning how to use a big girl camera and wanted something larger than a point and shoot, with full control over ISO, aperture, and shutter speed, without spending a fortune. I am very pleased with my Panasonic Lumix DMC FZ47. The price is very reasonable and I am able to play around with all the aforementioned options. The lens is also AWESOME ! My one complaint is only 12 mp- would love 14.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I love the clarity of the photos and the quick recovery speed in taking a second or third shot. Weight and size were critical for me as I wanted something small for travel yet enough lens to get some decent bird pictures. The 24 Panasonic zoom lens is right in line with my built-in Leica 35-240 lens.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: About to be a first time grandparent so I figured,it was time for a step up in the camera department! My sister is a photography maniac so I knew she would steer me in the right direction! It's got advanced functions that I'm learning, but easy enough PHD (push here dummy) settings for someone like me who is just learning! I couldn't be more satisfied. Thank you so much for a great product at a great price!

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: I am not by any stretch of imagination a pro when it comes to photography. Just wanted something lightweight, with good zoom and can take good pictures. I read in another site that this camera has one of the best color reproduction, although I cannot compare with anything I am very pleased with the pictures I have taken so far. Camera has a lot of features and for a novice like me, it took some figuring out the best settings given the situation. Once I got a hang of it, the results were excellent. I wasn't able to get it at the low black Friday deal since I was still thinking then if I should get the FZ-150. At $220 though, it's still a very good deal, considering some other sites were selling them $30-80 more.
Cons: If you want a simple point and shoot this may not be "it" fo ... r you. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Camera was on sale before Christmas for under $200 and it's by far and away the best camera you can find anywhere for the money. Incredible zoom, rechargeable battery pack that lasts quite a while and you can find additional batteries for the same price as a 4 pack of li-ion AA batteries.
Battery/SD card door is well designed and doesn't seem to have any little plastic tabs that would be prone to breaking. Even if it did the battery and SD card are held in separate from the door and each other allowing you to switch out SD cards without having pop out batteries.
1080p video with stereo sound that lets you use optical zoom while recording and even has an option to automatically cancel out what little zoom sound the motor makes. In other words it's rather quite without t ... he feature on and virtually inaudible when it is on.
Just feels solid all around and you can tell the quality. Seems like this should be at least a five hundred dollar camera, if you need one this is a great cho
Cons: Has a 15, 30, and 60 second stary night mode that is really neat, however on the longer exposure times due to the rotation of the earth the stars have a slight streak to them especially when zoomed in.
Comparing it to other cameras in the price range I've tried out the flash isn't quite as good but still more than adequate for taking good pictures.
No help button, if you don't know what a setting does you have to consult the .pdf on the CD.
I'm just trying to get as detailed as possible, there really aren't any cons at all with this camera, just minor gripes, so don't let anything said here detract from it in any way.
There are TONS of different settings menus and picture modes to play with and it can be quite intimidating and will take a while to get adept at if you aren't used to this sort of thing. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have a Sony Nex 3 and the Lumix. When I bought the Nex 3 I thought I would have great abilities. Basically - the Nex 3 offered everything very well but no real telephoto ability. Not able to afford the telephoto lens for the camera so I bought the Lumix. Right away - this has become my favorite camera. It is quick, lite and since I am into natural photography, I have been taken by the ability to enjoy some really great shots. I have great photos of birds like the skittish Blue Heron - which I took at some distance and even having to blow them up - they were excellent in their detail. If there is one disappointment - it is the digital zoom only works when you decrease the size of the photo. Hence - the quality can suffer. Also, it would be nice if this was automatic meaning as I ... am looking for greater zoom, the picture automatically decreases so that I don't have to change the settings as before I take the picture. So far, what I know is I have to reset the photo size each time I turn the camera on. This is annoying - Otherwise, I have taken some really beautiful photos in the short time I had this camera. I am very happy with it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I grew up with film cameras and this super zoom is fantastic. Note that I own two other Panasonic cameras. The first is a DMC-TZ3 and the second is a DMC-FH1. Each camera is an improvement on the previous owned camera in its own way. Key importance for the FZ47K was the ability to take wildlife photos from great distance and closeups of wildflowers with good color renditions. This camera does auto focus very quickly, has the best image stabilization yet when using high zoom to capture pictures from a distance allowing the camera to be handheld. Pictures so far have excellent sharpness and very good color rendition. Controls are easy to use asthey are almost identical on all three cameras. Am very pleased with this camera and the pictures produced. No complaints or reservations con ... cerning this product. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: If you've ever had a Panasonic point-n-shoot, you'll love this. Menu's the same, familiar buttons, excellent photos, all the things you loved before. If you've never had a Panasonic, it's time to get one. I had a DMC-FZ7 that I used for years, and passed it on to my daughter when I bought the GH1. Now I bought her this and she loves it. Picked up it and knew what and where everything was. And the price was great! She uses it for high school football games, fun at the beach, sunsets, portraits, everything. Not a bad picture yet.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Good size and weight wutg excellent results from the many functions available. Very good video. Would have appreciated the Advanced Instruction Manual that is only available on enclosed disk, online or hard copy for around $38.00. Not Fair!

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very Fast and Easy to Use
Item.Review: I've only had this camera a couple weeks, so I reserve the right to revise my ratings and comments later if necessary. So far, I'm impressed with its speed. It boots up quickly, fires with no perceptible shutter lag, and when the flash is opened, it's ready to as soon as you can composed a shot. It feels great in the hand with a large grip and controls that fall readily to the right fingers without getting in the way. I'm really liking it so far.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The zoom is the main feature is this camera. It works as advertised. In normal to bright light where shutter speeds are adequate, the zoom is quite spectacular with good stabilization. I bought the camera for the EVF as LCD screens in the sunshine are frustrating. The viewfinder is adequate. I recommend the camera for a DSLR user who wants something lighter in his/her travel kit or for a point and shoot user who wants the big zoom with only a modest increase in size.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Honestly there are no drawbacks to this camera. One really wonderful aspect is the lightness and the design of the fit to ones hand is great. The Leica lens,some as good, none better. The closest competitor is double the price. Great value and quality usually are not used in the same sentence but in this case it is the truth. Buy this camera.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Can point and shoot or use like an programmable SLR. 1080 HD video. Electronic viewfinder for sunny days. Many others...
Cons: No RAW and no hot shoe. Not really a problem for most.
The more I use it, the more I love it. The burst mode is great. Gotta read the DVD manual to really get familiar with the functions and all the capabilities. Even at $300, it's a great bridge camera.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: I wanted something with a super zoom and a great lens. Ideally I wanted a Leica but couldn't afford it. I got the next best thing - a Panasonic with a Leica lens. This is really a great little camera. It's light, has tons of setting, is easy to use and is good for a beginner or someone like me that likes to sometimes point and shoot and other times take control of what I'm shooting.
Cons: None so far.
Kudos to NewEgg. I ordered the camera on a Monday and it arrived on Tuesday by 10 AM. I don't know how they did it but they did. Also, it was at a great price point.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have not had a chance to take advantage of all this camera has to offer. The zoom lens works well. Taking a snapshot while taking a video is great. I checked that out. I know I will really enjoy this camera.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted a better camera with a descent zoom range but did not want to carry more equipment. We like the outdoors and I love taking pictures of animals and scenery. So far this camera is just what I wanted without spending a great deal of money!!!

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: So far we are very happy with the FZ47. Pictures on the auto setting are great. Still haven't dug into all the other setting options. The only negative so far is the flash does not deploy automatically. Still we are happy with the camera.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Light weight and easy to handle.
Cons: Image Quality
As a dedicated Panasonic Camera fan I purchased 4 of these cameras based on my previous experience with 4 fine Panasonic Ultra-zooms Cameras (Fz30, FZ8, 18 & FZ35). But when I took comparison photos (literally hundreds) with the former FZ35 model, a camera with superb reviews, the FZ47 image quality was simply awful in comparison. Fine detail was severely lacking as the ISO climbed above 100. For me, all that matters is image quality, forget the rest, so I sold all four of the FZ47's I purchased for family members. I was very disappointed in this camera given my past experience with Panasonic Cameras.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Awesome images in the dark and in any light and even several blocks away. The zoom feature is incredible. simply loving it
Cons: I didn't have one years ago
gota great deal only form Newegg

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Well if your last camera was a point and shoot and you need something in between before you move on to the fancy world of DSLRs, this camera is for you. There are just enough settings that you can play around with on this one. It is a great camera to start learning. Around $230 it was as cheap/costly as my point n shoot which I think is a steal!

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Panasonic DMC-FZ47K Black 12.1 MP 24X Optical Zoom 25mm Wide Angle Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Great camera; even the digital zoom (127X) gave me good pictures; Panorama shots easy to set up even handheld; Reviews say don't use iso 1600 but the pictures were pretty good (probably not for 16X20's); No red eye so far (much better than my FZ20); Very fast start up and recording to SD card. Have not done much with video
Cons: Manual focus awkward to use. My FZ20's manual focus much better.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is used for snapshots of grandkids and outdoor bicycling trips. So far it has only been used in the full auto mode, and works very well. The lack of a comprehesive written instruction book is a low point. You have to have your laptop with you to read the owners manuel. Still a very nice camera, and I would purchase again

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Most awesome camera I've ever owned
Item.Review: This camera far exceeds my expectations, both in product quality, picture quality and ease of use. I'm not a professional photographer, but I feel like one with this camera. The picture features are fun to play around with and learn how to use, and when I don't have time for that the IA feature truly rocks - even in low light situations I get amazing pictures. I bought my Dad a Nikon Coolpix L120 for christmas and this camera is far easier to use than that one is and I think the picture quality is better as well.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am using it to take videos of my kids programmes, like dance etc. The video is clear and captures the music very well. Very good for taking illuminated pics in the dark.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Appears to take a 52mm filter, seems to have screw threads in lens. The manual isn't comprehensive, suppose to use cd, couldn't find a downloadable manual on site. Hoping the Leica lens is a good one. My old Leica with a 90mm lens was great. The coating made the difference, I think. Really like the viewfinder and the time lapse features.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I purchased this camera for a trip to Africa. As an inexperienced photographer I was looking for ease of use and quality at a reasonable price. I got much more than I needed. My B&H Sales person gave me great direction, I followed his advice and the rest was easy. Great trip, great memories, great picture.....and easy to use....

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Feels naturally good in your hands, and mine are large with a little shake. The one-button manual focus control is fantastic. Great flash range. Absolutely clear focus at any zoom.
Cons: Would feel a tad better if the focus, and the record, bottons swithed places.
Ordered Saturday on a one-day special for $189 shipped. It arrived Tuesday morning and, my smile has gotten larger ever since.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I purchased this camera at the last minute for a trip to use as a general camera and for wildlife shots. Picture quality was excellent. Camera was generally easy to use. I would definitely recommend this camera. Thre are a few cons - when using the zoom, the camera shakes so it is not always easy to get the shot. There are a few too many setting options, meaning you really need to have read and studied the manual. The manual, however, like so many now, is on disc or available online. Having a printed manual would be much more useful.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Having previously owned a film SLR & not being able to afford a DSLR I've played with 'lookalike Digitals' with no satisfaction to date. With the Panasonic Lumix FZ47 I am more than happy with this excellent little camera. It's more than a compromise - it's a new way of taking photo's without the hassle of carrying a number of interchangeble lenses.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I FIND THE CAMERA TO BE TERRIFIC SO FAR BUT I HAVE JUST PURCHASED IT.MY ONE AND ONLY COMPLAINT IS THAT THE INSTRUCTIONS THAT COME WITH THE CAMERA ARE INSUFFICIANT.THE ALTERNATIVE IS 189 PAGES ON MY COMPUTER.SURELY AN INTERMEDIATE BOOKLET SUPPLIED WITH THE CAMERA WITH SAY APPROX 50 -60 PAGES IS JUSTIFIED. I HAVE TO SAY HOWEVER THE THING THAT IS VERY IMPRESSIVE IS THE BUILD QUALITY WHICH IS SUPERB. A CLASS PRODUCT FROM PANASONIC.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Panasonic DMC-FZ47K Black 12.1 MP 24X Optical Zoom 25mm Wide Angle Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Given as gift. They really enjoy it. Her last camera was stolen, I think she'll be more careful with this one.
Cons: Extra battery packs are expensive. Would almost always prefer AA's! But the camera was exactly what looking for so we settled.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Not sure if I am sold on their picture software but the camera itself seems to take good pictures--takes a bit to figure out the functions, especially for those of us who like to go manual... definitely worth the price...

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: $189, Black Friday Deal 24X Zoom Amazing Clarity Best Battery (I took 497 Pics, with a single charge, Additionally, i reviewed some PICS of them on Battery too) Electronic View Finder (One Click change b/w EVF and LCD) 1028p HD Recording (Awesome Clarity) Not a DSLR but can Compete any mid-range DSLR Less Weight The list goes on like forever...
Cons: Very few pics turned out be blurr..I heard there is an option called power OSI to reduce it, need to try that and see
Shipping was little late for my Excitement
Best point and shoot camera till date and Black Friday deal is a Steal. The free camera bag was way to small for this camera. Don't Hesitate to buy if it's under $200, Even at $250 it's still a worth one.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: I own a few point and shoot cameras, I have to say this Ponasonic DMC-FZ47K is one of the best..Is even better then the Canon 880 that i own, Thank you to NEWEGG, Good job. Got my FZ47 for a good price..10 eggs
Cons: None, What so ever....

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: I got what I was looking for: The most camera I could find for under $200. - Takes indoor office-room, and outdoor scenery with no difficulty - Compensates for shake - Fast processor
Cons: none
- Instruction manual on the included disk, in English is 190 half-size pages. - I installed WINTEC FileMate 16GB class 10 SDHC memory card

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: First of all, I'm no professional. I simply enjoy being able to take a good quality picture when the opportunity presents itself. Up until a few years ago, I always purchased Canon products knowing that I would get an acceptable result without having to spend a fortune. That changed with the 1st couple of Canon digital camera purchases---lousy quality,and high prices forced me to look elsewhere. There might be other manufacturers equal to Panasonic, but I'm not aware of them. Right off the bat I bought one of their point and shoots and was impressed with quality of pic's, price, ease of use, etc., etc. This FZ-47 continues down the same road...I have nothing but good things to say about this and other Panasonic products I own. I might add, for whatever it's worth, that I used the zoom for ... a shot of my pool ladder from inside my house shooting through a pane of glass, through my screened-in porch and the resulting photo was excellent. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Seems to be a fabulous camera!
Item.Review: A great camera with many fine features. But it is beyond my amateur capabilities, so I would recommend having a desire to learn all the capabilities this camera has to offer to use it to the full.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I purchased this as a gift, but I opened it to make sure everything was ok.It was of course. So, the more I looked at it I decided that with the money I receive as gifts this year...I really think I'll be purchasing one for my self. Oh and your shipping time was perfect!!!! Thanks!

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Just got this camera over the Black Friday weekend. Have used it just a little bit but find the camera really nice. The body is great for comfortably holding it. The low light shooting is the biggest con. I bought it though knowing this and haven't really been disappointed. The zoom is great as well.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: what i like best about the camera is the color quality. it is absolutely better than the nykon i have. But the problem is that the camera is to big to be carrying around every single day. I have not used it yet that much but i am really happy i got it.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: i'm still learning how to use this camera, but when i was shopping for a new one, i knew i wanted one that had video capabilities, but was more than just a point and shoot. i'm very pleased so far. I can't wait to learn more with the manual settings, to get some great photo's!

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I haven't used the product yet. It was purchased as a gift, I did however open it up and take a peek. Seems like a well rounded camera and it should be the perfect gift for the person it was purchased for. They are not camera savvy, but I thought it was time to bring them out of the early 2000's point in shoot era.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is very easy to use, take good quality food and also videos. Has a powerfull zoom lanses wicht is very very good I used and approved. I'm in love with this camera, was the right choice for me.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I found it extremely disappointing that Panasonic removed the ability to shoot images in the RAW format with their latest superzoom models. Not everyone wants to be able to post process images on their computer, but if you are someone who does (like me) this is a major omission which really limits what you can do with the image after capture. For me, Panasonic's decision to remove this featured was a deal killer.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera for my wife to use. She hates when she is outside on a sunny day and can't see LCD screen. This camera has both LCD and view finder, which she loves.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: It is a great camera, excellent pictures
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Zoom; Easy To Use; Large Clear LCD; Good in Low Light; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Nice Body Color; Good Image Stabilization; Good Image Quality
Cons: None
I use it for family and scenario views.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Panasonic's Lumix FZ-47 is a rare example of how a lightweight, low-cost and compact point-and-shoot camera can be at the same time complete in built-in resources and offer more than expected. It is a perfect equipment for amateurs/semi-professionals photographers.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Camera - bad customer service NewEgg
Item.Review:
Pros: Great photos, easy to use
Cons: Video recording does not record sound intermittently, been working with tech support from Panasonic and so far they are no help, tried returning to newegg and they will not allow it since it is over 30 days (only 3 days past), also they won't give me the lower price on the item that they are charging now.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent long zoom, good for outdoors
Item.Review: super fast and accurate auto-focus, even under low light, noisy above ISO 400, sharp under normal light , for long zoom it is enough, at ISO 100-200 you can have good IQ, it it sunny camera, light and easy to carry not like my DSLR as piece of metal.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Weight 1lb with battery and memory card great macro pictures, zoom is amazing, features, full hd movies look great even in low light, 3D, can attach filters - great black friday deal with memory card $187 and free shipping
Cons: Manual is very simplistic, not enough info on features usage - hdmi cable not included

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: A really great camera,saw all the features took pics ganesh great pics I especially loved the HD video mp4 looks very crisp,only thing I'm still looking for is the 3d button 0_o anyways was well worth the buy for $189 on black Friday. Thx Newegg.
Cons: None so far.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: None
Cons: The product i got has some defualt. 1. I can hear some noise (like something is hitting a film) if i hold the camera in my hands and try to rotate just my hand without doing anything. I think some mechanical problem is there in it. 2.I can hear some other noise if i put on bettery on this and do the same as mentioned above 3.Display screen do not have protective layer it means this camera is not brand new as found with product name (Lumix DMC FZ47 R). While placing the order it was not mentioned. I am not sure it is the problem of this model or only specific to this device.
While placing the order it was mentioned that i can return this item in 2 months (60 days) if not satisfied but when i received my Lumix DMC FZ47 it was mentioned that i am no ... t eligible to return it as product is still under warranty. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: This little Camera is huge, just amazing
Item.Review: I own a 200 & 300 Nikons and several lenses, but this is a lot more casual and easy , practical, for random shots like for U tube and whatever you come up with .

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: clear shots and view finder for day time
Item.Review: light weight, good battery life, great videos, and a view finder for day time shots. I have a point and shot lumix and I'm happy with the Panasonic brand.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great: -Zoom Range -Comfortability in it's buttons -Functionality -Rec button Not so great: -Sensor size (small) -Can't save RAW -

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great zoom and wonderful photo features. This is a fabulous point and shoot camera. Optical view finder is a great additional feature

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Nice body and design, good quality picture. Very fast capture. 24x optical zoom is the best for the price. Nothing against it so far.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: 1. Picture Quality 2. Black Friday offer Price. 3. 24X zoom 4. Best for people who love point and shoot cameras
Cons: None found as of now

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: No RAW, could be a delabreaker for some
Item.Review: No RAW, but otherwise excellent bridge/megazoom camera with sharp lens & good ergonomics. So so low light images, a weak point of all P&S cameras.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: All the features needed as a step-up from point and shoot; earlier models highly regarded by users known personally

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Love it ! Just what I wished for!
Item.Review: Love this camera taking high quality stills and a great use For the video !! Great quality too! Very light weight which is great because I travel a lot.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great camera for the money. Easy to use and takes great pictures.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Being a profecional film camera man, this camera allows you to feel almost like a regular 35 camera. MF, Aperture,& greatPin hole option

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I liked the price at which it was sold. Moreover, the way all features and everything was described.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Awesome camera for a great price
Item.Review: Getting a Leica lenses for this price is incredible.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Easy, small compared to other semi reflex cameras! Nice photos, easy to use, light! I am really happy !

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: excellent camera...very clear pictures, numerous features to give photos that special touch

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Right out of the box, took night time photos came out great, next day took day time photos using zoom awesome pictures

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great camera - intelligent auto or manual, lots of features, good zoom

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm a casual user and this camera has been very nice so far. Very easy to use and colors seem acurate.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Just got started with the camera but it really works, great. Easy to use, good quality of the photos and great zoom. Haven't found any negative yet :-)

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The camera has an amazing zoom and great image quality, without the bulk of a SLR. Great for traveling.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I would buy this product again and again
Item.Review: FAST FOR A POINT AND SHOOT

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Love the long zoom. Video is a nice addition to an SLR.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Very nice features. Need to do your homework to take avantage of all the features. Good quality product overall.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great color, clarity and ease of use.
Item.Review: Needed a camera for quick, spontaneous shots that also allowed creativity. The Lumix DMC-FZ47 does it all.

Item.Item: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Don't judge a book by its cove
Item.Review: It is a complete camera, but not complete my expectations. I thought it was as good as the TZ5. Anyway, I like, and I try for a while more. Thank you.

Item.Review: Great optical zoom.
